comment:
* Class for retrieving various kinds of information related to the application * packages that are currently installed on the device. * * You can find this class through {@link Context#getPackageManager}. * *

Note: If your app targets Android 11 (API level 30) or * higher, the methods in this class each return a filtered list of apps. Learn more about how to * manage package visibility. *

variables.name: APPLY_DEFAULT_TO_DEVICE_PROTECTED_STORAGE
variables.comment: {@hide}

variables.name: ENABLE_SHARED_UID_MIGRATION
variables.comment: {@hide}

variables.name: PROPERTY_MEDIA_CAPABILITIES
PROPERTY_SELF_CERTIFIED_NETWORK_CAPABILITIES
variables.comment:
* <application> level {@link android.content.pm.PackageManager.Property} tag * specifying the XML resource ID containing the declaration of the self-certified network * capabilities used by the application. * *

Starting from Android 14, usage of some network capabilities in * {@link android.net.ConnectivityManager#requestNetwork} require the application to * declare its usage of that particular capability in this resource. Only some capabilities * require a declaration. Please look up the specific capability you want to use in * {@link android.net.NetworkCapabilities} to see if it needs declaration in this property. * * For example: * <application> * <property android:name="android.net.PROPERTY_SELF_CERTIFIED_NETWORK_CAPABILITIES" * android:resource="@xml/self_certified_network_capabilities"> * <application> * *

The detail format of self_certified_network_capabilities.xml is described in * {@link android.net.NetworkRequest}

variables.name: PROPERTY_NO_APP_DATA_STORAGE
variables.comment:
* Application level property that an app can specify to opt-out from having private data * directories both on the internal and external storages. * *

Changing the value of this property during app update is not supported, and such updates * will be rejected. * *

This should only be set by platform apps that know what they are doing. * * @hide

variables.name: PROPERTY_SPECIAL_USE_FGS_SUBTYPE
PROPERTY_COMPAT_OVERRIDE_LANDSCAPE_TO_PORTRAIT
variables.comment:
* Application level {@link android.content.pm.PackageManager.Property PackageManager * .Property} for an app to inform the system that the app can be opted-in or opted-out * from the compatibility treatment that rotates camera output by 90 degrees on landscape * sensors on devices known to have compatibility issues. * *

The treatment is disabled by default but device manufacturers can enable the treatment * using their discretion to improve camera compatibility. With this property set to * {@code false}, the rotation will not be applied. A value of {@code true} * will ensure that rotation is applied, provided it is enabled for the device. In most cases, * if rotation is the desired behavior this property need not be set. However, if your app * experiences stretching or incorrect rotation on these devices, explicitly setting this to * {@code true} may resolve that behavior. Apps should set this to {@code false} if there * is confidence that the app handles * {@link android.hardware.camera2.CameraCharacteristics#SENSOR_ORIENTATION} correctly. * See the * documentation for best practice. * *

Syntax: * 

     * <application>
     *   <property
     *     android:name="android.camera.PROPERTY_COMPAT_OVERRIDE_LANDSCAPE_TO_PORTRAIT"
     *     android:value="true|false"/>
     * </application>
     *

variables.name: PROPERTY_LEGACY_UPDATE_OWNERSHIP_DENYLIST
variables.comment:
* Application level {@link android.content.pm.PackageManager.Property PackageManager * .Property} for a privileged system installer to define a list of up to 500 packages that * should not have their updates owned by any installer. The list must be provided via a default * XML resource with the following format: * * 
     * <deny-ownership>PACKAGE_NAME</deny-ownership>
     * <deny-ownership>PACKAGE_NAME</deny-ownership>
     *
* * NOTE: Installers that provide this property will not granted update ownership for any * packages that they request update ownership of. * @hide

variables.name: PROPERTY_ANDROID_SAFETY_LABEL
variables.comment:
* Application level {@link android.content.pm.PackageManager.Property PackageManager * .Property} for a app to inform the installer that a file containing the app's android * safety label data is bundled into the APK as a raw resource. * *

For example: * 

     * <application>
     *   <property
     *     android:name="android.content.PROPERTY_ANDROID_SAFETY_LABEL"
     *     android:resource="@raw/app-metadata"/>
     * </application>
     *
* @hide

variables.name: TYPE_UNKNOWN
variables.comment: @hide

variables.name: TYPE_ACTIVITY
variables.comment: @hide

variables.name: TYPE_RECEIVER
variables.comment: @hide

variables.name: TYPE_SERVICE
variables.comment: @hide

variables.name: TYPE_PROVIDER
variables.comment: @hide

variables.name: TYPE_APPLICATION
variables.comment: @hide

variables.name: GET_ACTIVITIES
variables.comment:
* {@link PackageInfo} flag: return information about
     * activities in the package in {@link PackageInfo#activities}.

variables.name: GET_RECEIVERS
variables.comment:
* {@link PackageInfo} flag: return information about
     * intent receivers in the package in
     * {@link PackageInfo#receivers}.

variables.name: GET_SERVICES
variables.comment:
* {@link PackageInfo} flag: return information about
     * services in the package in {@link PackageInfo#services}.

variables.name: GET_PROVIDERS
variables.comment:
* {@link PackageInfo} flag: return information about
     * content providers in the package in
     * {@link PackageInfo#providers}.

variables.name: GET_INSTRUMENTATION
variables.comment:
* {@link PackageInfo} flag: return information about
     * instrumentation in the package in
     * {@link PackageInfo#instrumentation}.

variables.name: GET_INTENT_FILTERS
variables.comment:
* {@link PackageInfo} flag: return information about the
     * intent filters supported by the activity.
     *
     * @deprecated The platform does not support getting {@link IntentFilter}s for the package.

variables.name: GET_SIGNATURES
variables.comment:
* {@link PackageInfo} flag: return information about the
     * signatures included in the package.
     *
     * @deprecated use {@code GET_SIGNING_CERTIFICATES} instead

variables.name: GET_RESOLVED_FILTER
variables.comment:
* {@link ResolveInfo} flag: return the IntentFilter that
     * was matched for a particular ResolveInfo in
     * {@link ResolveInfo#filter}.

variables.name: GET_META_DATA
GET_GIDS
variables.comment:
* {@link PackageInfo} flag: return the
     * {@link PackageInfo#gids group ids} that are associated with an
     * application.
     * This applies for any API returning a PackageInfo class, either
     * directly or nested inside of another.

variables.name: GET_DISABLED_COMPONENTS
variables.comment: * @deprecated replaced with {@link #MATCH_DISABLED_COMPONENTS}

variables.name: MATCH_DISABLED_COMPONENTS
variables.comment: * {@link PackageInfo} flag: include disabled components in the returned info.

variables.name: GET_SHARED_LIBRARY_FILES
variables.comment:
* {@link ApplicationInfo} flag: return the
     * {@link ApplicationInfo#sharedLibraryFiles paths to the shared libraries}
     * that are associated with an application.
     * This applies for any API returning an ApplicationInfo class, either
     * directly or nested inside of another.

variables.name: GET_URI_PERMISSION_PATTERNS
variables.comment:
* {@link ProviderInfo} flag: return the
     * {@link ProviderInfo#uriPermissionPatterns URI permission patterns}
     * that are associated with a content provider.
     * This applies for any API returning a ProviderInfo class, either
     * directly or nested inside of another.

variables.name: GET_PERMISSIONS
variables.comment:
* {@link PackageInfo} flag: return information about
     * permissions in the package in
     * {@link PackageInfo#permissions}.

variables.name: GET_UNINSTALLED_PACKAGES
variables.comment: * @deprecated replaced with {@link #MATCH_UNINSTALLED_PACKAGES}

variables.name: MATCH_UNINSTALLED_PACKAGES
variables.comment:
* Flag parameter to retrieve some information about all applications (even * uninstalled ones) which have data directories. This state could have * resulted if applications have been deleted with flag * {@code DELETE_KEEP_DATA} with a possibility of being replaced or * reinstalled in future. *

* Note: this flag may cause less information about currently installed * applications to be returned. *

* Note: use of this flag requires the android.permission.QUERY_ALL_PACKAGES * permission to see uninstalled packages.

variables.name: GET_CONFIGURATIONS
variables.comment:
* {@link PackageInfo} flag: return information about
     * hardware preferences in
     * {@link PackageInfo#configPreferences PackageInfo.configPreferences},
     * and requested features in {@link PackageInfo#reqFeatures} and
     * {@link PackageInfo#featureGroups}.

variables.name: GET_DISABLED_UNTIL_USED_COMPONENTS
variables.comment: * @deprecated replaced with {@link #MATCH_DISABLED_UNTIL_USED_COMPONENTS}.

variables.name: MATCH_DISABLED_UNTIL_USED_COMPONENTS
variables.comment:
* {@link PackageInfo} flag: include disabled components which are in
     * that state only because of {@link #COMPONENT_ENABLED_STATE_DISABLED_UNTIL_USED}
     * in the returned info.  Note that if you set this flag, applications
     * that are in this disabled state will be reported as enabled.

variables.name: MATCH_DEFAULT_ONLY
variables.comment:
* Resolution and querying flag: if set, only filters that support the
     * {@link android.content.Intent#CATEGORY_DEFAULT} will be considered for
     * matching.  This is a synonym for including the CATEGORY_DEFAULT in your
     * supplied Intent.

variables.name: MATCH_ALL
variables.comment:
* Querying flag: if set and if the platform is doing any filtering of the * results, then the filtering will not happen. This is a synonym for saying * that all results should be returned. *

* This flag should be used with extreme care.

variables.name: MATCH_DIRECT_BOOT_UNAWARE
variables.comment:
* Querying flag: match components which are direct boot unaware in * the returned info, regardless of the current user state. *

* When neither {@link #MATCH_DIRECT_BOOT_AWARE} nor * {@link #MATCH_DIRECT_BOOT_UNAWARE} are specified, the default behavior is * to match only runnable components based on the user state. For example, * when a user is started but credentials have not been presented yet, the * user is running "locked" and only {@link #MATCH_DIRECT_BOOT_AWARE} * components are returned. Once the user credentials have been presented, * the user is running "unlocked" and both {@link #MATCH_DIRECT_BOOT_AWARE} * and {@link #MATCH_DIRECT_BOOT_UNAWARE} components are returned. * * @see UserManager#isUserUnlocked()

variables.name: MATCH_DIRECT_BOOT_AWARE
variables.comment:
* Querying flag: match components which are direct boot aware in * the returned info, regardless of the current user state. *

* When neither {@link #MATCH_DIRECT_BOOT_AWARE} nor * {@link #MATCH_DIRECT_BOOT_UNAWARE} are specified, the default behavior is * to match only runnable components based on the user state. For example, * when a user is started but credentials have not been presented yet, the * user is running "locked" and only {@link #MATCH_DIRECT_BOOT_AWARE} * components are returned. Once the user credentials have been presented, * the user is running "unlocked" and both {@link #MATCH_DIRECT_BOOT_AWARE} * and {@link #MATCH_DIRECT_BOOT_UNAWARE} components are returned. * * @see UserManager#isUserUnlocked()

variables.name: MATCH_SYSTEM_ONLY
variables.comment:
* Querying flag: include only components from applications that are marked
     * with {@link ApplicationInfo#FLAG_SYSTEM}.

variables.name: MATCH_FACTORY_ONLY
variables.comment:
* Internal {@link PackageInfo} flag: include only components on the system image.
     * This will not return information on any unbundled update to system components.
     * @hide

variables.name: MATCH_ANY_USER
variables.comment:
* Allows querying of packages installed for any user, not just the specific one. This flag
     * is only meant for use by apps that have INTERACT_ACROSS_USERS permission.
     * @hide

variables.name: MATCH_KNOWN_PACKAGES
variables.comment:
* Combination of MATCH_ANY_USER and MATCH_UNINSTALLED_PACKAGES to mean any known
     * package.
     * @hide

variables.name: MATCH_INSTANT
variables.comment:
* Internal {@link PackageInfo} flag: include components that are part of an
     * instant app. By default, instant app components are not matched.
     * @hide

variables.name: MATCH_VISIBLE_TO_INSTANT_APP_ONLY
variables.comment:
* Internal {@link PackageInfo} flag: include only components that are exposed to
     * instant apps. Matched components may have been either explicitly or implicitly
     * exposed.
     * @hide

variables.name: MATCH_EXPLICITLY_VISIBLE_ONLY
variables.comment:
* Internal {@link PackageInfo} flag: include only components that have been
     * explicitly exposed to instant apps.
     * @hide

variables.name: MATCH_STATIC_SHARED_AND_SDK_LIBRARIES
variables.comment:
* Internal {@link PackageInfo} flag: include static shared and SDK libraries.
     * Apps that depend on static shared/SDK libs can always access the version
     * of the lib they depend on. System/shell/root can access all shared
     * libs regardless of dependency but need to explicitly ask for them
     * via this flag.
     * @hide

variables.name: GET_SIGNING_CERTIFICATES
variables.comment:
* {@link PackageInfo} flag: return the signing certificates associated with
     * this package.  Each entry is a signing certificate that the package
     * has proven it is authorized to use, usually a past signing certificate from
     * which it has rotated.

variables.name: MATCH_DIRECT_BOOT_AUTO
variables.comment:
* Querying flag: automatically match components based on their Direct Boot * awareness and the current user state. *

* Since the default behavior is to automatically apply the current user * state, this is effectively a sentinel value that doesn't change the * output of any queries based on its presence or absence. *

* Instead, this value can be useful in conjunction with * {@link android.os.StrictMode.VmPolicy.Builder#detectImplicitDirectBoot()} * to detect when a caller is relying on implicit automatic matching, * instead of confirming the explicit behavior they want, using a * combination of these flags: *

    *
  • {@link #MATCH_DIRECT_BOOT_AWARE} *
  • {@link #MATCH_DIRECT_BOOT_UNAWARE} *
  • {@link #MATCH_DIRECT_BOOT_AUTO} *

variables.name: MATCH_DEBUG_TRIAGED_MISSING
variables.comment: @hide

variables.name: MATCH_CLONE_PROFILE
variables.comment:
* @deprecated Use {@link #MATCH_CLONE_PROFILE_LONG} instead.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: MATCH_HIDDEN_UNTIL_INSTALLED_COMPONENTS
variables.comment:
* {@link PackageInfo} flag: include system apps that are in the uninstalled state and have
     * been set to be hidden until installed via {@link #setSystemAppState}.
     * @hide

variables.name: MATCH_APEX
variables.comment:
* {@link PackageInfo} flag: include APEX packages that are currently
     * installed. In APEX terminology, this corresponds to packages that are
     * currently active, i.e. mounted and available to other processes of the OS.
     * In particular, this flag alone will not match APEX files that are staged
     * for activation at next reboot.

variables.name: GET_ATTRIBUTIONS
variables.comment: * @deprecated Use {@link #GET_ATTRIBUTIONS_LONG} to avoid unintended sign extension.

variables.name: GET_ATTRIBUTIONS_LONG
variables.comment: * {@link PackageInfo} flag: return all attributions declared in the package manifest

variables.name: MATCH_ARCHIVED_PACKAGES
variables.comment:
* Flag parameter to also retrieve some information about archived packages. * Packages can be archived through {@link PackageInstaller#requestArchive} and do not have any * APKs stored on the device, but do keep the data directory. *

Note: Archived apps are a subset of apps returned by {@link #MATCH_UNINSTALLED_PACKAGES}. *

Note: this flag may cause less information about currently installed * applications to be returned. *

Note: use of this flag requires the android.permission.QUERY_ALL_PACKAGES * permission to see uninstalled packages.

variables.name: MATCH_QUARANTINED_COMPONENTS
variables.comment:
* Querying flag: always match components of packages in quarantined state.
     * @see #isPackageQuarantined

variables.name: MATCH_CLONE_PROFILE_LONG
variables.comment:
* {@link ResolveInfo} flag: allow matching components across clone profile *

* This flag is used only for query and not resolution, the default behaviour would be to * restrict querying across clone profile. This flag would be honored only if caller have * permission {@link Manifest.permission.QUERY_CLONED_APPS}. * * @hide

variables.name: SKIP_CURRENT_PROFILE
variables.comment:
* Flag for {@link #addCrossProfileIntentFilter}: if this flag is set: when
     * resolving an intent that matches the {@code CrossProfileIntentFilter},
     * the current profile will be skipped. Only activities in the target user
     * can respond to the intent.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: ONLY_IF_NO_MATCH_FOUND
variables.comment:
* Flag for {@link #addCrossProfileIntentFilter}: if this flag is set:
     * activities in the other profiles can respond to the intent only if no activity with
     * non-negative priority in current profile can respond to the intent.
     * @hide

variables.name: MODULE_APEX_NAME
variables.comment:
* Flag for {@link #getModuleInfo}: allow ModuleInfo to be retrieved using the apex module
     * name, rather than the package name.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: PERMISSION_GRANTED
variables.comment:
* Permission check result: this is returned by {@link #checkPermission}
     * if the permission has been granted to the given package.

variables.name: PERMISSION_DENIED
variables.comment:
* Permission check result: this is returned by {@link #checkPermission}
     * if the permission has not been granted to the given package.

variables.name: SIGNATURE_MATCH
variables.comment:
* Signature check result: this is returned by {@link #checkSignatures}
     * if all signatures on the two packages match.

variables.name: SIGNATURE_NEITHER_SIGNED
variables.comment:
* Signature check result: this is returned by {@link #checkSignatures}
     * if neither of the two packages is signed.

variables.name: SIGNATURE_FIRST_NOT_SIGNED
variables.comment:
* Signature check result: this is returned by {@link #checkSignatures}
     * if the first package is not signed but the second is.

variables.name: SIGNATURE_SECOND_NOT_SIGNED
variables.comment:
* Signature check result: this is returned by {@link #checkSignatures}
     * if the second package is not signed but the first is.

variables.name: SIGNATURE_NO_MATCH
variables.comment:
* Signature check result: this is returned by {@link #checkSignatures}
     * if not all signatures on both packages match.

variables.name: SIGNATURE_UNKNOWN_PACKAGE
variables.comment:
* Signature check result: this is returned by {@link #checkSignatures}
     * if either of the packages are not valid.

variables.name: COMPONENT_ENABLED_STATE_DEFAULT
variables.comment:
* Flag for {@link #setApplicationEnabledSetting(String, int, int)} and * {@link #setComponentEnabledSetting(ComponentName, int, int)}: This * component or application is in its default enabled state (as specified in * its manifest). *

* Explicitly setting the component state to this value restores it's * enabled state to whatever is set in the manifest.

variables.name: COMPONENT_ENABLED_STATE_ENABLED
variables.comment:
* Flag for {@link #setApplicationEnabledSetting(String, int, int)}
     * and {@link #setComponentEnabledSetting(ComponentName, int, int)}: This
     * component or application has been explictily enabled, regardless of
     * what it has specified in its manifest.

variables.name: COMPONENT_ENABLED_STATE_DISABLED
variables.comment:
* Flag for {@link #setApplicationEnabledSetting(String, int, int)}
     * and {@link #setComponentEnabledSetting(ComponentName, int, int)}: This
     * component or application has been explicitly disabled, regardless of
     * what it has specified in its manifest.

variables.name: COMPONENT_ENABLED_STATE_DISABLED_USER
variables.comment: * Flag for {@link #setApplicationEnabledSetting(String, int, int)} only: The * user has explicitly disabled the application, regardless of what it has * specified in its manifest. Because this is due to the user's request, * they may re-enable it if desired through the appropriate system UI. This * option currently cannot be used with * {@link #setComponentEnabledSetting(ComponentName, int, int)}.

variables.name: COMPONENT_ENABLED_STATE_DISABLED_UNTIL_USED
variables.comment: * Flag for {@link #setApplicationEnabledSetting(String, int, int)} only: This * application should be considered, until the point where the user actually * wants to use it. This means that it will not normally show up to the user * (such as in the launcher), but various parts of the user interface can * use {@link #GET_DISABLED_UNTIL_USED_COMPONENTS} to still see it and allow * the user to select it (as for example an IME, device admin, etc). Such code, * once the user has selected the app, should at that point also make it enabled. * This option currently can not be used with * {@link #setComponentEnabledSetting(ComponentName, int, int)}.

variables.name: ROLLBACK_DATA_POLICY_RESTORE
variables.comment:
* User data will be backed up during install and restored during rollback.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: ROLLBACK_DATA_POLICY_WIPE
variables.comment:
* User data won't be backed up during install but will be wiped out during rollback.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: ROLLBACK_DATA_POLICY_RETAIN
variables.comment:
* User data won't be backed up during install and will remain unchanged during rollback.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: ROLLBACK_USER_IMPACT_LOW
variables.comment:
* Rollback will be performed automatically in response to native crashes on startup or
     * persistent service crashes. More suitable for apps that do not store any user data.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: ROLLBACK_USER_IMPACT_HIGH
variables.comment:
* Rollback will be performed automatically only when the device is found to be unrecoverable.
     * More suitable for apps that store user data and have higher impact on user.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: ROLLBACK_USER_IMPACT_ONLY_MANUAL
variables.comment:
* Rollback will not be performed automatically. It can be triggered externally.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_REPLACE_EXISTING
variables.comment:
* Flag parameter for {@link #installPackage} to indicate that you want to
     * replace an already installed package, if one exists.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_ALLOW_TEST
variables.comment:
* Flag parameter for {@link #installPackage} to indicate that you want to
     * allow test packages (those that have set android:testOnly in their
     * manifest) to be installed.
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_INTERNAL
variables.comment:
* Flag parameter for {@link #installPackage} to indicate that this package
     * must be installed to internal storage.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_FROM_ADB
variables.comment:
* Flag parameter for {@link #installPackage} to indicate that this install
     * was initiated via ADB.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_ALL_USERS
variables.comment:
* Flag parameter for {@link #installPackage} to indicate that this install
     * should immediately be visible to all users.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_REQUEST_DOWNGRADE
variables.comment:
* Flag parameter for {@link #installPackage} to indicate that an upgrade to a lower version * of a package than currently installed has been requested. * *

Note that this flag doesn't guarantee that downgrade will be performed. That decision * depends * on whenever: *

    *
  • An app is debuggable. *
  • Or a build is debuggable. *
  • Or {@link #INSTALL_ALLOW_DOWNGRADE} is set. *
* * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_GRANT_ALL_REQUESTED_PERMISSIONS
variables.comment:
* Flag parameter for package install to indicate that all requested permissions should be
     * granted to the package. If {@link #INSTALL_ALL_USERS} is set the runtime permissions will
     * be granted to all users, otherwise only to the owner.
     * <p/>
     * If this flag is set, {@link SessionParams#setPermissionState(String, int)} should not be
     * called.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_FORCE_VOLUME_UUID
variables.comment: {@hide}

variables.name: INSTALL_FORCE_PERMISSION_PROMPT
variables.comment:
* Flag parameter for {@link #installPackage} to indicate that we always want to force
     * the prompt for permission approval. This overrides any special behaviour for internal
     * components.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_INSTANT_APP
variables.comment:
* Flag parameter for {@link #installPackage} to indicate that this package is
     * to be installed as a lightweight "ephemeral" app.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_DONT_KILL_APP
variables.comment:
* Flag parameter for {@link #installPackage} to indicate that this package contains
     * a feature split to an existing application and the existing application should not
     * be killed during the installation process.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_FULL_APP
variables.comment:
* Flag parameter for {@link #installPackage} to indicate that this package is
     * to be installed as a heavy weight app. This is fundamentally the opposite of
     * {@link #INSTALL_INSTANT_APP}.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_ALLOCATE_AGGRESSIVE
variables.comment:
* Flag parameter for {@link #installPackage} to indicate that this package
     * is critical to system health or security, meaning the system should use
     * {@link StorageManager#FLAG_ALLOCATE_AGGRESSIVE} internally.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_VIRTUAL_PRELOAD
variables.comment:
* Flag parameter for {@link #installPackage} to indicate that this package
     * is a virtual preload.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_APEX
variables.comment:
* Flag parameter for {@link #installPackage} to indicate that this package
     * is an APEX package
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_ENABLE_ROLLBACK
variables.comment:
* Flag parameter for {@link #installPackage} to indicate that rollback
     * should be enabled for this install.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_DISABLE_VERIFICATION
variables.comment:
* Flag parameter for {@link #installPackage} to indicate that package verification should be
     * disabled for this package.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_ALLOW_DOWNGRADE
variables.comment:
* Flag parameter for {@link #installPackage} to indicate that
     * {@link #INSTALL_REQUEST_DOWNGRADE} should be allowed.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_STAGED
variables.comment:
* Flag parameter for {@link #installPackage} to indicate that this package
     * is being installed as part of a staged install.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_ALL_WHITELIST_RESTRICTED_PERMISSIONS
variables.comment:
* Flag parameter for {@link #installPackage} to indicate that all restricted * permissions should be allowlisted. If {@link #INSTALL_ALL_USERS} * is set the restricted permissions will be allowlisted for all users, otherwise * only to the owner. * *

* Note: In retrospect it would have been preferred to use * more inclusive terminology when naming this API. Similar APIs added will * refrain from using the term "whitelist". *

* * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_DISABLE_ALLOWED_APEX_UPDATE_CHECK
variables.comment:
* Flag parameter for {@link #installPackage} to indicate that check whether given APEX can be
     * updated should be disabled for this install.
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_BYPASS_LOW_TARGET_SDK_BLOCK
variables.comment:
* Flag parameter for {@link #installPackage} to bypass the low targer sdk version block
     * for this install.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_REQUEST_UPDATE_OWNERSHIP
variables.comment:
* Flag parameter for {@link SessionParams} to indicate that the
     * update ownership enforcement is requested.
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_FROM_MANAGED_USER_OR_PROFILE
variables.comment:
* Flag parameter for {@link PackageInstaller.SessionParams} to indicate that this
     * session is from a managed user or profile.
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_ARCHIVED
variables.comment:
* Flag parameter for {@link PackageInstaller.SessionParams} to indicate that this
     * session is for archived package installation.
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_IGNORE_DEXOPT_PROFILE
variables.comment:
* If set, all dexopt profiles are ignored by dexopt during the installation, including the
     * profile in the DM file and the profile embedded in the APK file. If an invalid profile is
     * provided during installation, no warning will be reported by {@code adb install}.
     *
     * This option does not affect later dexopt operations (e.g., background dexopt and manual `pm
     * compile` invocations).
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_UNARCHIVE_DRAFT
variables.comment:
* If set, then the session is a draft session created for an upcoming unarchival by its
     * installer.
     *
     * @see PackageInstaller#requestUnarchive
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_UNARCHIVE
variables.comment:
* If set, then the {@link PackageInstaller.Session} is an unarchival.
     *
     * @see PackageInstaller#requestUnarchive
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_DEVELOPMENT_FORCE_NON_STAGED_APEX_UPDATE
variables.comment:
* Flag parameter for {@link #installPackage} to force a non-staged update of an APEX. This is
     * a development-only feature and should not be used on end user devices.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: DONT_KILL_APP
variables.comment:
* Flag parameter for
     * {@link #setComponentEnabledSetting(android.content.ComponentName, int, int)} to indicate
     * that you don't want to kill the app containing the component.  Be careful when you set this
     * since changing component states can make the containing application's behavior unpredictable.

variables.name: SYNCHRONOUS
variables.comment:
* Flag parameter for
     * {@link #setComponentEnabledSetting(android.content.ComponentName, int, int)} to indicate
     * that the given user's package restrictions state will be serialised to disk after the
     * component state has been updated. Note that this is synchronous disk access, so calls using
     * this flag should be run on a background thread.

variables.name: FLAG_SUSPEND_QUARANTINED
variables.comment:
* Flag parameter {@link #setPackagesSuspended(String[], boolean, PersistableBundle,
     * PersistableBundle, android.content.pm.SuspendDialogInfo, int)}:
     * Apps in this state not only appear suspended for all user visible purposes (eg, Launcher,
     * ShareSheet), but also individual components of the app can behave as disabled depending on
     * the importance of the calling app.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_REASON_UNKNOWN
variables.comment: * Code indicating that the reason for installing this package is unknown.

variables.name: INSTALL_REASON_POLICY
variables.comment: * Code indicating that this package was installed due to enterprise policy.

variables.name: INSTALL_REASON_DEVICE_RESTORE
variables.comment: * Code indicating that this package was installed as part of restoring from another device.

variables.name: INSTALL_REASON_DEVICE_SETUP
variables.comment: * Code indicating that this package was installed as part of device setup.

variables.name: INSTALL_REASON_USER
variables.comment: * Code indicating that the package installation was initiated by the user.

variables.name: INSTALL_REASON_ROLLBACK
variables.comment:
* Code indicating that the package installation was a rollback initiated by RollbackManager.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_SCENARIO_DEFAULT
variables.comment: * A value to indicate the lack of CUJ information, disabling all installation scenario logic.

variables.name: INSTALL_SCENARIO_FAST
variables.comment: * Installation scenario providing the fastest â€œinstall button to launch" experience possible.

variables.name: INSTALL_SCENARIO_BULK
variables.comment:
* Installation scenario indicating a bulk operation with the desired result of a fully
     * optimized application.  If the system is busy or resources are scarce the system will
     * perform less work to avoid impacting system health.
     *
     * Examples of bulk installation scenarios might include device restore, background updates of
     * multiple applications, or user-triggered updates for all applications.
     *
     * The decision to use BULK or BULK_SECONDARY should be based on the desired user experience.
     * BULK_SECONDARY operations may take less time to complete but, when they do, will produce
     * less optimized applications.  The device state (e.g. memory usage or battery status) should
     * not be considered when making this decision as those factors are taken into account by the
     * Package Manager when acting on the installation scenario.

variables.name: INSTALL_SCENARIO_BULK_SECONDARY
variables.comment:
* Installation scenario indicating a bulk operation that prioritizes minimal system health
     * impact over application optimization.  The application may undergo additional optimization
     * if the system is idle and system resources are abundant.  The more elements of a bulk
     * operation that are marked BULK_SECONDARY, the faster the entire bulk operation will be.
     *
     * See the comments for INSTALL_SCENARIO_BULK for more information.

variables.name: UNINSTALL_REASON_UNKNOWN
variables.comment:
* Code indicating that the reason for uninstalling this package is unknown.
     * @hide

variables.name: UNINSTALL_REASON_USER_TYPE
variables.comment:
* Code indicating that this package was uninstalled due to the type of user.
     * See UserSystemPackageInstaller
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_UNKNOWN
variables.comment: * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_SUCCEEDED
variables.comment:
* Installation return code: this is passed in the {@link PackageInstaller#EXTRA_LEGACY_STATUS}
     * on success.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_FAILED_ALREADY_EXISTS
variables.comment:
* Installation return code: this is passed in the {@link PackageInstaller#EXTRA_LEGACY_STATUS}
     * if the package is already installed.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_FAILED_INVALID_APK
variables.comment:
* Installation return code: this is passed in the {@link PackageInstaller#EXTRA_LEGACY_STATUS}
     * if the package archive file is invalid.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_FAILED_INVALID_URI
variables.comment:
* Installation return code: this is passed in the {@link PackageInstaller#EXTRA_LEGACY_STATUS}
     * if the URI passed in is invalid.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_FAILED_INSUFFICIENT_STORAGE
variables.comment:
* Installation return code: this is passed in the {@link PackageInstaller#EXTRA_LEGACY_STATUS}
     * if the package manager service found that the device didn't have enough storage space to
     * install the app.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_FAILED_DUPLICATE_PACKAGE
variables.comment:
* Installation return code: this is passed in the {@link PackageInstaller#EXTRA_LEGACY_STATUS}
     * if a package is already installed with the same name.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_FAILED_NO_SHARED_USER
variables.comment:
* Installation return code: this is passed in the {@link PackageInstaller#EXTRA_LEGACY_STATUS}
     * if the requested shared user does not exist.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_FAILED_UPDATE_INCOMPATIBLE
variables.comment:
* Installation return code: this is passed in the {@link PackageInstaller#EXTRA_LEGACY_STATUS}
     * if a previously installed package of the same name has a different signature than the new
     * package (and the old package's data was not removed).
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_FAILED_SHARED_USER_INCOMPATIBLE
variables.comment:
* Installation return code: this is passed in the {@link PackageInstaller#EXTRA_LEGACY_STATUS}
     * if the new package is requested a shared user which is already installed on the device and
     * does not have matching signature.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_FAILED_MISSING_SHARED_LIBRARY
variables.comment:
* Installation return code: this is passed in the {@link PackageInstaller#EXTRA_LEGACY_STATUS}
     * if the new package uses a shared library that is not available.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_FAILED_REPLACE_COULDNT_DELETE
variables.comment:
* Installation return code: this is passed in the {@link PackageInstaller#EXTRA_LEGACY_STATUS}
     * when the package being replaced is a system app and the caller didn't provide the
     * {@link #DELETE_SYSTEM_APP} flag.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_FAILED_DEXOPT
variables.comment:
* Installation return code: this is passed in the {@link PackageInstaller#EXTRA_LEGACY_STATUS}
     * if the new package failed while optimizing and validating its dex files, either because there
     * was not enough storage or the validation failed.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_FAILED_OLDER_SDK
variables.comment:
* Installation return code: this is passed in the {@link PackageInstaller#EXTRA_LEGACY_STATUS}
     * if the new package failed because the current SDK version is older than that required by the
     * package.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_FAILED_CONFLICTING_PROVIDER
variables.comment:
* Installation return code: this is passed in the {@link PackageInstaller#EXTRA_LEGACY_STATUS}
     * if the new package failed because it contains a content provider with the same authority as a
     * provider already installed in the system.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_FAILED_NEWER_SDK
variables.comment:
* Installation return code: this is passed in the {@link PackageInstaller#EXTRA_LEGACY_STATUS}
     * if the new package failed because the current SDK version is newer than that required by the
     * package.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_FAILED_TEST_ONLY
variables.comment:
* Installation return code: this is passed in the {@link PackageInstaller#EXTRA_LEGACY_STATUS}
     * if the new package failed because it has specified that it is a test-only package and the
     * caller has not supplied the {@link #INSTALL_ALLOW_TEST} flag.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_FAILED_CPU_ABI_INCOMPATIBLE
variables.comment:
* Installation return code: this is passed in the {@link PackageInstaller#EXTRA_LEGACY_STATUS}
     * if the package being installed contains native code, but none that is compatible with the
     * device's CPU_ABI.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_FAILED_MISSING_FEATURE
variables.comment:
* Installation return code: this is passed in the {@link PackageInstaller#EXTRA_LEGACY_STATUS}
     * if the new package uses a feature that is not available.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_FAILED_CONTAINER_ERROR
variables.comment:
* Installation return code: this is passed in the
     * {@link PackageInstaller#EXTRA_LEGACY_STATUS} if a secure container mount point couldn't be
     * accessed on external media.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_FAILED_INVALID_INSTALL_LOCATION
variables.comment:
* Installation return code: this is passed in the {@link PackageInstaller#EXTRA_LEGACY_STATUS}
     * if the new package couldn't be installed in the specified install location.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_FAILED_MEDIA_UNAVAILABLE
variables.comment:
* Installation return code: this is passed in the {@link PackageInstaller#EXTRA_LEGACY_STATUS}
     * if the new package couldn't be installed in the specified install location because the media
     * is not available.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_FAILED_VERIFICATION_TIMEOUT
variables.comment:
* Installation return code: this is passed in the {@link PackageInstaller#EXTRA_LEGACY_STATUS}
     * if the new package couldn't be installed because the verification timed out.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_FAILED_VERIFICATION_FAILURE
variables.comment:
* Installation return code: this is passed in the {@link PackageInstaller#EXTRA_LEGACY_STATUS}
     * if the new package couldn't be installed because the verification did not succeed.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_FAILED_PACKAGE_CHANGED
variables.comment:
* Installation return code: this is passed in the {@link PackageInstaller#EXTRA_LEGACY_STATUS}
     * if the package changed from what the calling program expected.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_FAILED_UID_CHANGED
variables.comment:
* Installation return code: this is passed in the {@link PackageInstaller#EXTRA_LEGACY_STATUS}
     * if the new package is assigned a different UID than it previously held.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_FAILED_VERSION_DOWNGRADE
variables.comment:
* Installation return code: this is passed in the {@link PackageInstaller#EXTRA_LEGACY_STATUS}
     * if the new package has an older version code than the currently installed package.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_FAILED_PERMISSION_MODEL_DOWNGRADE
variables.comment:
* Installation return code: this is passed in the {@link PackageInstaller#EXTRA_LEGACY_STATUS}
     * if the old package has target SDK high enough to support runtime permission and the new
     * package has target SDK low enough to not support runtime permissions.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_FAILED_SANDBOX_VERSION_DOWNGRADE
variables.comment:
* Installation return code: this is passed in the {@link PackageInstaller#EXTRA_LEGACY_STATUS}
     * if the new package attempts to downgrade the target sandbox version of the app.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_FAILED_MISSING_SPLIT
variables.comment:
* Installation return code: this is passed in the {@link PackageInstaller#EXTRA_LEGACY_STATUS}
     * if the new package requires at least one split and it was not provided.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_FAILED_DEPRECATED_SDK_VERSION
variables.comment:
* Installation return code: this is passed in the {@link PackageInstaller#EXTRA_LEGACY_STATUS}
     * if the new package targets a deprecated SDK version.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_PARSE_FAILED_NOT_APK
variables.comment:
* Installation parse return code: this is passed in the
     * {@link PackageInstaller#EXTRA_LEGACY_STATUS} if the parser was given a path that is not a
     * file, or does not end with the expected '.apk' extension.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_PARSE_FAILED_BAD_MANIFEST
variables.comment:
* Installation parse return code: this is passed in the
     * {@link PackageInstaller#EXTRA_LEGACY_STATUS} if the parser was unable to retrieve the
     * AndroidManifest.xml file.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_PARSE_FAILED_UNEXPECTED_EXCEPTION
variables.comment:
* Installation parse return code: this is passed in the
     * {@link PackageInstaller#EXTRA_LEGACY_STATUS} if the parser encountered an unexpected
     * exception.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_PARSE_FAILED_NO_CERTIFICATES
variables.comment:
* Installation parse return code: this is passed in the
     * {@link PackageInstaller#EXTRA_LEGACY_STATUS} if the parser did not find any certificates in
     * the .apk.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_PARSE_FAILED_INCONSISTENT_CERTIFICATES
variables.comment:
* Installation parse return code: this is passed in the
     * {@link PackageInstaller#EXTRA_LEGACY_STATUS} if the parser found inconsistent certificates on
     * the files in the .apk.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_PARSE_FAILED_CERTIFICATE_ENCODING
variables.comment:
* Installation parse return code: this is passed in the
     * {@link PackageInstaller#EXTRA_LEGACY_STATUS} if the parser encountered a
     * CertificateEncodingException in one of the files in the .apk.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_PARSE_FAILED_BAD_PACKAGE_NAME
variables.comment:
* Installation parse return code: this is passed in the
     * {@link PackageInstaller#EXTRA_LEGACY_STATUS} if the parser encountered a bad or missing
     * package name in the manifest.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_PARSE_FAILED_BAD_SHARED_USER_ID
variables.comment:
* Installation parse return code: tthis is passed in the
     * {@link PackageInstaller#EXTRA_LEGACY_STATUS} if the parser encountered a bad shared user id
     * name in the manifest.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_PARSE_FAILED_MANIFEST_MALFORMED
variables.comment:
* Installation parse return code: this is passed in the
     * {@link PackageInstaller#EXTRA_LEGACY_STATUS} if the parser encountered some structural
     * problem in the manifest.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_PARSE_FAILED_MANIFEST_EMPTY
variables.comment:
* Installation parse return code: this is passed in the
     * {@link PackageInstaller#EXTRA_LEGACY_STATUS} if the parser did not find any actionable tags
     * (instrumentation or application) in the manifest.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_FAILED_INTERNAL_ERROR
variables.comment:
* Installation failed return code: this is passed in the
     * {@link PackageInstaller#EXTRA_LEGACY_STATUS} if the system failed to install the package
     * because of system issues.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_FAILED_USER_RESTRICTED
variables.comment:
* Installation failed return code: this is passed in the
     * {@link PackageInstaller#EXTRA_LEGACY_STATUS} if the system failed to install the package
     * because the user is restricted from installing apps.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_FAILED_DUPLICATE_PERMISSION
variables.comment:
* Installation failed return code: this is passed in the * {@link PackageInstaller#EXTRA_LEGACY_STATUS} if the system failed to install the package * because it is attempting to define a permission that is already defined by some existing * package. *

* The package name of the app which has already defined the permission is passed to a * {@link PackageInstallObserver}, if any, as the {@link #EXTRA_FAILURE_EXISTING_PACKAGE} string * extra; and the name of the permission being redefined is passed in the * {@link #EXTRA_FAILURE_EXISTING_PERMISSION} string extra. * * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_FAILED_NO_MATCHING_ABIS
variables.comment:
* Installation failed return code: this is passed in the
     * {@link PackageInstaller#EXTRA_LEGACY_STATUS} if the system failed to install the package
     * because its packaged native code did not match any of the ABIs supported by the system.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: NO_NATIVE_LIBRARIES
variables.comment:
* Internal return code for NativeLibraryHelper methods to indicate that the package
     * being processed did not contain any native code. This is placed here only so that
     * it can belong to the same value space as the other install failure codes.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_FAILED_ABORTED
variables.comment: {@hide}

variables.name: INSTALL_FAILED_SESSION_INVALID
variables.comment:
* Installation failed return code: install type is incompatible with some other
     * installation flags supplied for the operation; or other circumstances such as trying
     * to upgrade a system app via an Incremental or instant app install.
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_FAILED_BAD_DEX_METADATA
variables.comment:
* Installation parse return code: this is passed in the
     * {@link PackageInstaller#EXTRA_LEGACY_STATUS} if the dex metadata file is invalid or
     * if there was no matching apk file for a dex metadata file.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_FAILED_BAD_SIGNATURE
variables.comment:
* Installation parse return code: this is passed in the
     * {@link PackageInstaller#EXTRA_LEGACY_STATUS} if there is any signature problem.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_FAILED_OTHER_STAGED_SESSION_IN_PROGRESS
variables.comment:
* Installation failed return code: a new staged session was attempted to be committed while
     * there is already one in-progress or new session has package that is already staged.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_FAILED_MULTIPACKAGE_INCONSISTENCY
variables.comment:
* Installation failed return code: one of the child sessions does not match the parent session
     * in respect to staged or rollback enabled parameters.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_FAILED_WRONG_INSTALLED_VERSION
variables.comment:
* Installation failed return code: the required installed version code
     * does not match the currently installed package version code.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_FAILED_PROCESS_NOT_DEFINED
variables.comment:
* Installation return code: this is passed in the {@link PackageInstaller#EXTRA_LEGACY_STATUS}
     * if the new package failed because it contains a request to use a process that was not
     * explicitly defined as part of its <processes> tag.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_PARSE_FAILED_RESOURCES_ARSC_COMPRESSED
variables.comment:
* Installation failed return code: the {@code resources.arsc} of one of the APKs being
     * installed is compressed or not aligned on a 4-byte boundary. Resource tables that cannot be
     * memory mapped exert excess memory pressure on the system and drastically slow down
     * construction of {@link Resources} objects.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_PARSE_FAILED_SKIPPED
variables.comment:
* Installation failed return code: the package was skipped and should be ignored.
     *
     * The reason for the skip is undefined.
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_FAILED_DUPLICATE_PERMISSION_GROUP
variables.comment:
* Installation failed return code: this is passed in the
     * {@link PackageInstaller#EXTRA_LEGACY_STATUS} if the system failed to install the package
     * because it is attempting to define a permission group that is already defined by some
     * existing package.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_FAILED_BAD_PERMISSION_GROUP
variables.comment:
* Installation failed return code: this is passed in the
     * {@link PackageInstaller#EXTRA_LEGACY_STATUS} if the system failed to install the package
     * because it is attempting to define a permission in a group that does not exists or that is
     * defined by an packages with an incompatible certificate.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_ACTIVATION_FAILED
variables.comment:
* Installation failed return code: an error occurred during the activation phase of this
     * session.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_FAILED_PRE_APPROVAL_NOT_AVAILABLE
variables.comment:
* Installation failed return code: requesting user pre-approval is currently unavailable.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_FAILED_SHARED_LIBRARY_BAD_CERTIFICATE_DIGEST
variables.comment:
* Installation return code: this is passed in the {@link PackageInstaller#EXTRA_LEGACY_STATUS}
     * if the new package declares bad certificate digest for a shared library in the package
     * manifest.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: INSTALL_FAILED_MULTI_ARCH_NOT_MATCH_ALL_NATIVE_ABIS
variables.comment:
* Installation failed return code: if the system failed to install the package that
     * {@link android.R.attr#multiArch} is true in its manifest because its packaged
     * native code did not match all of the natively ABIs supported by the system.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: USER_MIN_ASPECT_RATIO_UNSET
variables.comment:
* No aspect ratio override has been set by user.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: USER_MIN_ASPECT_RATIO_SPLIT_SCREEN
variables.comment:
* Aspect ratio override code: user forces app to split screen aspect ratio. This is adjusted to
     * half of the screen without the split screen divider.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: USER_MIN_ASPECT_RATIO_DISPLAY_SIZE
variables.comment:
* Aspect ratio override code: user forces app to the aspect ratio of the device display size.
     * This will be the portrait aspect ratio of the device if the app has fixed portrait
     * orientation or the landscape aspect ratio of the device if the app has fixed landscape
     * orientation.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: USER_MIN_ASPECT_RATIO_4_3
variables.comment:
* Aspect ratio override code: user forces app to 4:3 min aspect ratio
     * @hide

variables.name: USER_MIN_ASPECT_RATIO_16_9
variables.comment:
* Aspect ratio override code: user forces app to 16:9 min aspect ratio
     * @hide

variables.name: USER_MIN_ASPECT_RATIO_3_2
variables.comment:
* Aspect ratio override code: user forces app to 3:2 min aspect ratio
     * @hide

variables.name: USER_MIN_ASPECT_RATIO_FULLSCREEN
variables.comment:
* Aspect ratio override code: user forces app to fullscreen
     * @hide

variables.name: USER_MIN_ASPECT_RATIO_APP_DEFAULT
variables.comment:
* Aspect ratio override code: user sets to app's default aspect ratio.
     * This resets both the user-forced aspect ratio, and the device manufacturer
     * per-app override {@link ActivityInfo#OVERRIDE_ANY_ORIENTATION_TO_USER}.
     * It is different from {@link #USER_MIN_ASPECT_RATIO_UNSET} as the latter may
     * apply the device manufacturer per-app orientation override if any,
     * @hide

variables.name: DELETE_KEEP_DATA
variables.comment:
* Flag parameter for {@link #deletePackage} to indicate that you don't want to delete the
     * package's data directory.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: DELETE_ALL_USERS
variables.comment:
* Flag parameter for {@link #deletePackage} to indicate that you want the
     * package deleted for all users.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: DELETE_SYSTEM_APP
variables.comment:
* Flag parameter for {@link #deletePackage} to indicate that, if you are calling
     * uninstall on a system that has been updated, then don't do the normal process
     * of uninstalling the update and rolling back to the older system version (which
     * needs to happen for all users); instead, just mark the app as uninstalled for
     * the current user.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: DELETE_DONT_KILL_APP
variables.comment:
* Flag parameter for {@link #deletePackage} to indicate that, if you are calling
     * uninstall on a package that is replaced to provide new feature splits, the
     * existing application should not be killed during the removal process.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: DELETE_ARCHIVE
variables.comment:
* Flag parameter for {@link PackageInstaller#uninstall(VersionedPackage, int, IntentSender)} to
     * indicate that the deletion is an archival. This
     * flag is only for internal usage as part of
     * {@link PackageInstaller#requestArchive}.

variables.name: DELETE_CHATTY
variables.comment:
* Flag parameter for {@link #deletePackage} to indicate that package deletion
     * should be chatty.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: DELETE_SUCCEEDED
variables.comment:
* Return code for when package deletion succeeds. This is passed to the
     * {@link IPackageDeleteObserver} if the system succeeded in deleting the
     * package.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: DELETE_FAILED_INTERNAL_ERROR
variables.comment:
* Deletion failed return code: this is passed to the
     * {@link IPackageDeleteObserver} if the system failed to delete the package
     * for an unspecified reason.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: DELETE_FAILED_DEVICE_POLICY_MANAGER
variables.comment:
* Deletion failed return code: this is passed to the
     * {@link IPackageDeleteObserver} if the system failed to delete the package
     * because it is the active DevicePolicy manager.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: DELETE_FAILED_USER_RESTRICTED
variables.comment:
* Deletion failed return code: this is passed to the
     * {@link IPackageDeleteObserver} if the system failed to delete the package
     * since the user is restricted.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: DELETE_FAILED_OWNER_BLOCKED
variables.comment:
* Deletion failed return code: this is passed to the
     * {@link IPackageDeleteObserver} if the system failed to delete the package
     * because a profile or device owner has marked the package as
     * uninstallable.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: DELETE_FAILED_ABORTED
variables.comment: {@hide}

variables.name: DELETE_FAILED_USED_SHARED_LIBRARY
variables.comment:
* Deletion failed return code: this is passed to the
     * {@link IPackageDeleteObserver} if the system failed to delete the package
     * because the packge is a shared library used by other installed packages.
     * {@hide}

variables.name: DELETE_FAILED_APP_PINNED
variables.comment:
* Deletion failed return code: this is passed to the
     * {@link IPackageDeleteObserver} if the system failed to delete the package
     * because there is an app pinned.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: DELETE_FAILED_FOR_CHILD_PROFILE
variables.comment:
* Deletion failed return code: this is passed to the
     * {@link IPackageDeleteObserver} if the system failed to delete the package
     * for any child profile with {@link UserProperties#getDeleteAppWithParent()} as true.
     * @hide

variables.name: MOVE_SUCCEEDED
variables.comment:
* Return code that is passed to the {@link IPackageMoveObserver} when the
     * package has been successfully moved by the system.

     * @hide

variables.name: MOVE_FAILED_INSUFFICIENT_STORAGE
variables.comment:
* Error code that is passed to the {@link IPackageMoveObserver} when the
     * package hasn't been successfully moved by the system because of
     * insufficient memory on specified media.

     * @hide

variables.name: MOVE_FAILED_DOESNT_EXIST
variables.comment:
* Error code that is passed to the {@link IPackageMoveObserver} if the
     * specified package doesn't exist.

     * @hide

variables.name: MOVE_FAILED_SYSTEM_PACKAGE
variables.comment:
* Error code that is passed to the {@link IPackageMoveObserver} if the
     * specified package cannot be moved since its a system package.

     * @hide

variables.name: MOVE_FAILED_INVALID_LOCATION
variables.comment:
* Error code that is passed to the {@link IPackageMoveObserver} if the
     * specified package cannot be moved to the specified location.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: MOVE_FAILED_INTERNAL_ERROR
variables.comment:
* Error code that is passed to the {@link IPackageMoveObserver} if the
     * specified package cannot be moved to the specified location.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: MOVE_FAILED_OPERATION_PENDING
variables.comment:
* Error code that is passed to the {@link IPackageMoveObserver} if the
     * specified package already has an operation pending in the queue.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: MOVE_FAILED_DEVICE_ADMIN
variables.comment:
* Error code that is passed to the {@link IPackageMoveObserver} if the
     * specified package cannot be moved since it contains a device admin.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: MOVE_FAILED_3RD_PARTY_NOT_ALLOWED_ON_INTERNAL
variables.comment:
* Error code that is passed to the {@link IPackageMoveObserver} if system does not allow
     * non-system apps to be moved to internal storage.

variables.comment: @hide

variables.name: MOVE_INTERNAL
variables.comment:
* Flag parameter for {@link #movePackage} to indicate that

     * been installed on external media.

variables.name: MOVE_EXTERNAL_MEDIA
variables.comment:
* Flag parameter for {@link #movePackage} to indicate that
     * the package should be moved to external media.

variables.comment: {@hide}

variables.name: EXTRA_PACKAGE_MONITOR_CALLBACK_RESULT
variables.comment:
* Extra field name for notifying package change event. Currently, it is used by PackageMonitor.
     * @hide

variables.name: VERIFICATION_ALLOW_WITHOUT_SUFFICIENT
variables.comment:
* Usable by the required verifier as the {@code verificationCode} argument
     * for {@link PackageManager#verifyPendingInstall} to indicate that it will
     * allow the installation to proceed without any of the optional verifiers
     * needing to vote.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: VERIFICATION_ALLOW
variables.comment:
* Used as the {@code verificationCode} argument for
     * {@link PackageManager#verifyPendingInstall} to indicate that the calling
     * package verifier allows the installation to proceed.

variables.name: VERIFICATION_REJECT
variables.comment:
* Used as the {@code verificationCode} argument for
     * {@link PackageManager#verifyPendingInstall} to indicate the calling
     * package verifier does not vote to allow the installation to proceed.

variables.name: INTENT_FILTER_VERIFICATION_SUCCESS
variables.comment:
* Used as the {@code verificationCode} argument for
     * {@link PackageManager#verifyIntentFilter} to indicate that the calling
     * IntentFilter Verifier confirms that the IntentFilter is verified.
     *
     * @deprecated Use {@link DomainVerificationManager} APIs.
     * @hide

variables.name: INTENT_FILTER_VERIFICATION_FAILURE
variables.comment:
* Used as the {@code verificationCode} argument for
     * {@link PackageManager#verifyIntentFilter} to indicate that the calling
     * IntentFilter Verifier confirms that the IntentFilter is NOT verified.
     *
     * @deprecated Use {@link DomainVerificationManager} APIs.
     * @hide

variables.name: INTENT_FILTER_DOMAIN_VERIFICATION_STATUS_UNDEFINED
variables.comment:
* Internal status code to indicate that an IntentFilter verification result is not specified.
     *
     * @deprecated Use {@link DomainVerificationManager} APIs.
     * @hide

variables.name: INTENT_FILTER_DOMAIN_VERIFICATION_STATUS_ASK
variables.comment:
* Used as the {@code status} argument for
     * {@link #updateIntentVerificationStatusAsUser} to indicate that the User
     * will always be prompted the Intent Disambiguation Dialog if there are two
     * or more Intent resolved for the IntentFilter's domain(s).
     *
     * @deprecated Use {@link DomainVerificationManager} APIs.
     * @hide

variables.name: INTENT_FILTER_DOMAIN_VERIFICATION_STATUS_ALWAYS
variables.comment:
* Used as the {@code status} argument for
     * {@link #updateIntentVerificationStatusAsUser} to indicate that the User
     * will never be prompted the Intent Disambiguation Dialog if there are two
     * or more resolution of the Intent. The default App for the domain(s)
     * specified in the IntentFilter will also ALWAYS be used.
     *
     * @deprecated Use {@link DomainVerificationManager} APIs.
     * @hide

variables.name: INTENT_FILTER_DOMAIN_VERIFICATION_STATUS_NEVER
variables.comment:
* Used as the {@code status} argument for
     * {@link #updateIntentVerificationStatusAsUser} to indicate that the User
     * may be prompted the Intent Disambiguation Dialog if there are two or more
     * Intent resolved. The default App for the domain(s) specified in the
     * IntentFilter will also NEVER be presented to the User.
     *
     * @deprecated Use {@link DomainVerificationManager} APIs.
     * @hide

variables.name: INTENT_FILTER_DOMAIN_VERIFICATION_STATUS_ALWAYS_ASK
variables.comment:
* Used as the {@code status} argument for
     * {@link #updateIntentVerificationStatusAsUser} to indicate that this app
     * should always be considered as an ambiguous candidate for handling the
     * matching Intent even if there are other candidate apps in the "always"
     * state. Put another way: if there are any 'always ask' apps in a set of
     * more than one candidate app, then a disambiguation is *always* presented
     * even if there is another candidate app with the 'always' state.
     *
     * @deprecated Use {@link DomainVerificationManager} APIs.
     * @hide

variables.name: APP_METADATA_SOURCE_UNKNOWN
variables.comment:
* Indicates that the app metadata does not exist or its source is unknown.

variables.name: APP_METADATA_SOURCE_APK
variables.comment:

variables.name: APP_METADATA_SOURCE_INSTALLER
variables.comment:

variables.name: APP_METADATA_SOURCE_SYSTEM_IMAGE

variables.comment:

variables.name: FEATURE_CAMERA_CONCURRENT
variables.comment:
* Feature for {@link #getSystemAvailableFeatures} and * {@link #hasSystemFeature}: The device's main front and back cameras can stream * concurrently as described in {@link * android.hardware.camera2.CameraManager#getConcurrentCameraIds()}. *

*

While {@link android.hardware.camera2.CameraManager#getConcurrentCameraIds()} and * associated APIs are only available on API level 30 or newer, this feature flag may be * advertised by devices on API levels below 30. If present on such a device, the same * guarantees hold: The main front and main back camera can be used at the same time, with * guaranteed stream configurations as defined in the table for concurrent streaming at * {@link android.hardware.camera2.CameraDevice#createCaptureSession(android.hardware.camera2.params.SessionConfiguration)}. *

variables.comment:

Known feature versions include: *

variables.name: FEATURE_VULKAN_HARDWARE_LEVEL
variables.comment:
* Feature for {@link #getSystemAvailableFeatures} and * {@link #hasSystemFeature(String, int)}: If this feature is supported, the Vulkan * implementation on this device is hardware accelerated, and the Vulkan native API will * enumerate at least one {@code VkPhysicalDevice}, and the feature version will indicate what * level of optional hardware features limits it supports. *

* Level 0 includes the base Vulkan requirements as well as: *

  • {@code VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures::textureCompressionETC2}
*

* Level 1 additionally includes: *

    *
  • {@code VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures::fullDrawIndexUint32}
    • *
  • {@code VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures::imageCubeArray}
    • *
  • {@code VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures::independentBlend}
    • *
  • {@code VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures::geometryShader}
    • *
  • {@code VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures::tessellationShader}
    • *
  • {@code VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures::sampleRateShading}
    • *
  • {@code VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures::textureCompressionASTC_LDR}
    • *
  • {@code VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures::fragmentStoresAndAtomics}
    • *
  • {@code VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures::shaderImageGatherExtended}
    • *
  • {@code VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures::shaderUniformBufferArrayDynamicIndexing}
    • *
  • {@code VkPhysicalDeviceFeatures::shaderSampledImageArrayDynamicIndexing}
    • *

variables.name: FEATURE_VULKAN_HARDWARE_COMPUTE
variables.comment:
* Feature for {@link #getSystemAvailableFeatures} and * {@link #hasSystemFeature(String, int)}: If this feature is supported, the Vulkan * implementation on this device is hardware accelerated, and the Vulkan native API will * enumerate at least one {@code VkPhysicalDevice}, and the feature version will indicate what * level of optional compute features that device supports beyond the Vulkan 1.0 requirements. *

* Compute level 0 indicates: *

    *
  • The {@code VK_KHR_variable_pointers} extension and * {@code VkPhysicalDeviceVariablePointerFeaturesKHR::variablePointers} feature are supported.
    • *
  • {@code VkPhysicalDeviceLimits::maxPerStageDescriptorStorageBuffers} is at least 16.
    • *

variables.name: FEATURE_VULKAN_HARDWARE_VERSION
variables.comment:
* Feature for {@link #getSystemAvailableFeatures} and * {@link #hasSystemFeature(String, int)}: If this feature is supported, the Vulkan * implementation on this device is hardware accelerated, and the feature version will indicate * the highest {@code VkPhysicalDeviceProperties::apiVersion} supported by the physical devices * that support the hardware level indicated by {@link #FEATURE_VULKAN_HARDWARE_LEVEL}. The * feature version uses the same encoding as Vulkan version numbers: *
    *
  • Major version number in bits 31-22
    • *
  • Minor version number in bits 21-12
    • *
  • Patch version number in bits 11-0
    • *
* A version of 1.1.0 or higher also indicates: *
    *
  • The {@code VK_ANDROID_external_memory_android_hardware_buffer} extension is * supported.
    • *
  • {@code SYNC_FD} external semaphore and fence handles are supported.
    • *
  • {@code VkPhysicalDeviceSamplerYcbcrConversionFeatures::samplerYcbcrConversion} is * supported.
    • *
* A subset of devices that support Vulkan 1.1 do so via software emulation. For more * information, see * Vulkan Design Guidelines.

variables.name: FEATURE_VULKAN_DEQP_LEVEL
variables.comment:
* Feature for {@link #getSystemAvailableFeatures} and * {@link #hasSystemFeature(String, int)}: If this feature is supported, the feature version * specifies a date such that the device is known to pass the Vulkan dEQP test suite associated * with that date. The date is encoded as follows: *
    *
  • Year in bits 31-16
    • *
  • Month in bits 15-8
    • *
  • Day in bits 7-0
    • *
*

* Example: 2019-03-01 is encoded as 0x07E30301, and would indicate that the device passes the * Vulkan dEQP test suite version that was current on 2019-03-01.

variables.name: FEATURE_OPENGLES_DEQP_LEVEL
variables.comment:
* Feature for {@link #getSystemAvailableFeatures} and * {@link #hasSystemFeature(String, int)}: If this feature is supported, the feature version * specifies a date such that the device is known to pass the OpenGLES dEQP test suite * associated with that date. The date is encoded as follows: *
    *
  • Year in bits 31-16
    • *
  • Month in bits 15-8
    • *
  • Day in bits 7-0
    • *
*

* Example: 2021-03-01 is encoded as 0x07E50301, and would indicate that the device passes the * OpenGL ES dEQP test suite version that was current on 2021-03-01.

variables.name: FEATURE_BROADCAST_RADIO

* Feature for {@link #getSystemAvailableFeatures} and
